text:
Men were duped and around 35 sovereigns of gold jewellery stolen in two separate incidents reported in Madurai city and Madurai rural police limits on Thursday.

In the incident reported in South Gate police limits in Madurai city, P. Selvam (35), a goldsmith from Dindigul district, who had come to purchase gold, was intercepted for enquiry by two men near a public sector bank at South Gate.

Assuming that the two were police, Mr. Selvam allegedly let them frisk his bag. The duo allegedly took away around 31 sovereigns worth gold kept in his bag and asked Mr. Selvam to collect it from police station. When Mr. Selvam contacted South Gate police, he realised that he was cheated.

In a similar incident reported in Usilampatti town police limits on Thursday morning, four sovereigns of gold jewellery were robbed from K. Karupaiah (70) by two men.
title: Men duped, jewels stolen from them
